title: Mack Builder
description: Mack Builder is a product configurator experience that allows anyone to realize the Mack Truck of their dreams. With the launch of the newly designed Mack Anthem™, Mack Trucks wanted to redesign and relaunch the configurator to help fleet buyers and brand enthusiasts to build a Mack.
I helped shape and design the experience from high-level UX and the interactive model to detailed product design across all viewport sizes allowing anyone, anywhere, to design a Mack.

TextBlock.title: Make Stuff, Break Stuff
TextBlock.text: With a finite budget for 3D renders, the truck configurator experience needed to be lean and repurpose as many image assets as much as possible. I explored many interactive models that focused on a guided linear experience while allowing a user to freely select categories of customization all while keeping the truck front and center.

TextBlock.title: Be an app
TextBlock.text: Many product configurators fall prey to feeling like add-ons to existing marketing websites. While part of the Mack digital ecosystem, Mack Builder is intended to feel like an application. With full-screen modals and eliminating extraneous information, the configurator experience is meant to feel like a digital product.

title: CSA
byline: Holding the future to a higher standard.
description: CSA Group has a long but hidden history in ensuring the products we use on a daily basis are safer for all. The CSA mark represents the gold standard in safety assurance and is found on products ranging from sinks and homewares to some of the most complex electronics in the world.

With over 100 years in making the world a safer place, CSA Group needed to renew their global story. The goal? An update that recognizes the 100 years of innovation and while leaving a legacy of holding the future to a higher standard.
As Creative Director of the multi-year initiative , I re-invigorated the mark and reshape all aspects of the brand - from identity, brand expression, photography direction and the digital experience.

TextBlock.title: The Mark that Created it All
TextBlock.text: Renewing the logo meant revisiting past incarnations of the CSA mark to truly understand the evolution of the identity. As a symbol that appears on thousands of products in the world, a radical redesign would mean endless hours of updating and create inconsistency across old and new product badging. I opted to perfect the original CSA mark from the 1900's mark by retaining the timeless quality of the geometric shape while refining the form optically and true geometry.

TextBlock.title: Expressing the Brand
TextBlock.text: From color, typeface selection, iconography and photography - all aspects of the brand were in service of creating a visual identity that manifests the brands characteristics. A color palette was selected that represented credibility and trust but also carry the gravitas of immediacy. I selected Acumin and Tiempos as primary typefaces to

TextBlock.title: Elevating the Story
TextBlock.text: CSA Group audiences are corporations looking to ensure the safety of the products they produce and a non-profit wing that is dedicated to the advancement and creation of standards themselves. The website was designed to cater to both sides of the business with easy to find information on testing and certification as well as standards creation.

title: FineTune
description: Studies have shown, the color temperature and intensity of artificial lighting is critical to human functioning both physically and psychologically. FineLite, a provider of custom lighting solutions, partnered with Airro Studio to design a system that allows for the optimal control of color temperature, intensity and duration of lighting in commercial spaces ranging from hospitals and schools to workpplaces.

The goal? To design a lighting system that is easy to deploy and setup with the aid of an iOS application. With FineTune, lighting is continuously tune-able with little to no assistance from a technician.

To build an app, I first understood the context and the behaviors of the audience at hand, built journey maps and concepted design interfaces. With partnering with Airro Studios, we designed an app for the commercial space that is as intuitive as other IOT applications. The result – an application that is intuitive to use with an interface tailored towards healthcare workers, teachers and other space managers.

TextBlock.title: User Journey & Controller
TextBlock.text: As an application that compliments technician installed hardware, task flow was an important consideration when designing the overall application. After a FineTune unit is installed, the app has to allow for a user to seemlessly discover a FineTune receiver, set initial parameters like naming, zones and initial lighting settings. The interface to control lighting is also fundamental to a great experience.

TextBlock.title: Intuitive Controls
TextBlock.text: The overall app was designed for portrait usage making adjustments to setting and color parameters easily accomplishable using a single hand. Unlike consumer lighting IoT applications where on-the-fly adjusting is a requirement, a FineTune controller is designed to be programmed once, with little need for on-the-fly adjusting. This allowed for an interface is primarily read-on only or programming mode. For both sets of actions, I looked towards familiar design patterns to create an interface that is intuitive to a broad range of users.

TextBlock.title: Timeline
TextBlock.text: The main view of the controller post set up is a timeline view showing the current color temperature and intensity. A scrollable pane allows an operator to see what's in store to ensure the schedule is running correctly.

TextBlock.title: Schedules
TextBlock.text: An interface that revolves around days of the week as most inhabitants of the space function on a weekly schedule. Allowing specific color schedules to be executed by day of the week down to the hour.

TextBlock.title: Wheeling Around
TextBlock.text: Operator audience was kept in mind while designing the interface. It had to be intuitive and simple while also allowing full control to more advanced users in complex installation scenarios.

title: Spectrum Enterprise
description: The Spectrum Enterprise brand spun off following the merger of Charter with Time Warner with a focus on a growing business services segment. As a challenger brand, Spectrum Enterprise needed a digital destination that embraced the companies newly formed rally cry - be unreasonable
I designed and creative directed the brands, TK

title: Cooler Screens
description: CoolerScreens is a startup focused on evolving the cooler aisle retail experience. Their solution replaces traditional glass cooler doors with IoT LCD's replete with motion sensors. Cooler Screen doors provide shopping insights, from nutrition information to recipes along with the ability for retailers to manage dynamic promotions and incentives.
I helped concept the digital experience for shoppers, created marketing material future investors and provided insight into possible advertising models.

title: Mango
description: While there are many language learning applications, only one focuses on teaching speaking fluently with the power of proven linguistic methodologies.

Mango Languages was in need of a brand transformation that positioned the brand as more than an application. The goal, to convey the vibrancy of global languages and how language learn unlocks a rich tapestry of cultural experiences.
As Creative Director, I lead a brand redesign effort from insights to execution across brand identity explorations and brand expression.

title: iMove
description: Moving across the country can be stressful, fortunately iMove, is here to make the process simple. With a native application on both the iOS and Google Play, employees and HR teams can plan and manage every step of the move.

I was involved in early product planning from workshops to stakeholder interviews to designing an application with intuitive interface that helps transferees keep track of every pivotal moment in their move.
While iMove ultimately decided to blend a few concepts together, my work was pivotal in the final version that was deployed. The result – an application that is worthy of an homescreen.

title: Mack
description: Positioning a 20-year old brand for future sucess through brand evolution and by evolving the digital presence, activating the brand using unique activations and extending the Mack story into other aspects of life.
As Associate Creative Director on the account, I helped envision a new digital experience for Mack trucks, created an AR

title: D’Addario
byline: Elevating ecommerce for an icon in the music industry.
description: D'Addario is one of the largest suppliers of musical equipment in the world. With thousands of products, global reach and an established brand, D'Addario needed a B2B platform that allowed hundreds of distributors to purchase products in bulk, see insights on purchasing trends and place orders quickly.

That platform I designed did exactly that and more. With features like speed-entry and the ability for publishers to promote products on brand, the experience was built for both shoppers and business alike.
